Aerial Conversion
  • Scripts
  • View page source

Scripts

The aerial conversion package is a collection of scripts and the aerial_conversion modules. The scripts provide command line tools to convert aerial imagery to a common format and projection (i.e. coco), and vice versa. The geojson2coco and coco2geojson scripts provides a python interface to the conversion tools available in aerial_conversion module.

scripts.coco2geojson module

This script supports converting a COCO dataset into a georeferenced geojson file.

scripts.coco2geojson.main(args=None)[source]

Command-line driver.

scripts.coco2geojson.merge_class_polygons_geopandas(tiles_df_zone_groups, crs, keep_geom_type)[source]

Merge overlapping polygons in each class/zone.

This method uses geopandas overlay to merge overlapping polygons in each class/zone.

Parameters:

  • tiles_df_zone_groups (list) – List of GeoDataFrames, one per zone (building/annotation typle/class)

  • crs (str) – Coordinate system

  • keep_geom_type (bool) – If not set, return only geometries of the same geometry type as df1 has, otherwise, return all resulting geometries. It it advised not to set this parameter. It is known to casue polygon matching issues.

Returns:

GeoDataFrame of merged polygons

Return type:

polygons_df (GeoDataFrame)

scripts.coco2geojson.merge_class_polygons_shapely(tiles_df_zone_groups, crs)[source]

Merge overlapping polygons in each class/zone.

This method uses shapely unary_union to merge overlapping polygons in each class/zone.

Parameters:

  • tiles_df_zone_groups (list) – List of GeoDataFrames, one per zone (building/annotation typle/class)

  • crs (str) – Coordinate system

Returns:

GeoDataFrame of merged polygons

Return type:

polygons_df (GeoDataFrame)

scripts.coco2geojson.shape_regulariser(polygon, simplify_tolerance, minimum_rotated_rectangle)[source]

Regularise the shape of a polygon.

Parameters:

  • polygon (shapely.geometry.Polygon) – Polygon to regularise

  • simplify_tolerance (float) – Tolerance for simplifying polygons. Accepts values between 0.0 and 1.0.

  • minimum_rotated_rectangle (bool) – If true, will return the minimum rotated rectangle of the polygon. If set, simplification will be ignored.

Returns:

Regularised polygon

Return type:

shapely.geometry.Polygon

scripts.geojson2coco module

This script supports converting a vector shapefile and raster file into a COCO format dataset.

scripts.geojson2coco.assemble_coco_json(raster_file_list, geojson, license_json, info_json, categories_json, colour)[source]
scripts.geojson2coco.main(args=None)[source]

Command-line driver.
